lines.text: [first lines]
Next please. Now what's the purpose of your visit?
Uh - passing through.
You and I had plans... our ashes into the sea... we swore to it, by God.
You're half dead. Together that makes one of us.

[shouts across creek]
Like I said, what's your name? You're gonna make it, ya gotta try.

[traumatized and hysterical]
My name is... my name... my name is...aahhg... my name...!

You're not only a whining kid that wastes his time; you're also deaf and half blind. Sure you can hear me now. But do you listen to that water? Can you hear those birds back there? Can you hear the insects - the wind and the trees creakin' and rubbin'? You're deaf to those frogs down there and the sun pingin' off of these rocks. You're deaf to your own heartbeat and me comin' up behind you. My God, boy, there's a whole symphony goin' on here and you can't hear a thing.

[shouts]
Why are you so mad at me? You wanna know my name? It's God! G - O - D, GOD!
Animals are a lot like people. You can tell a lot about 'em from what they leave behind. If you're hungry enough, you look for sign.
What's this?
That's a kangaroo sign.
Looks a lot like a large rabbit poop to me.
I thought I could never come back here unless I had the world in my pocket. It's almost like someone else's dream. All those wasted years. Trying to find out who I was.
You're Foley. Patrick Foley.
Yeah. Thanks. And you're Daley. Shawn Daley.
Afraid? Why there's nothin' to be afraid of, except a cold wind. It'll kill ya, just for standing around looking dumb.
[last line]

[places Magic Medicin Bag on grave]
This'll keep away all the evil spirits.
It's a valley within a valley, it isn't easy to find or get into. It's never been put on a map, except once, but that's just on old log map. I made that map about 40 years ago.
"Nothing belongs here that wasn't born here."
